p:
The alarmingly high prevalences of HIV and HCV amongst PWID in India, which exceed 60% in some cities, indicate that additional attention must be paid to these groups to end the local HIV and HCV epidemics
30, 31 . To address this gap in knowledge, the following study presents the first large scale characterization of HIV and HCV viral strains circulating amongst PWID in five cities across Northern, Northeastern, and Central India.
